rComments: Terrible lecturer. Boring class. Terrible lecturer. I'm taking another one of her classes this quarter and she admitted that someone called her out for being committed to too many things and it shows. As others have mentioned, she seems scatterbrained in class, like she's not totally there.

Comical and passionate, but not always a very clear lecturer and tends to go too in-depth. The book was closely followed, but was also the densest, wordiest book I've ever had. Horrible. Grading was hard. Tests were tricky. Very difficult to obtain one-on-one attention. Spends too much time socializing, not enough taking questions.

the class was ridiculously boring, pretty much an overview of the very dense required reading. she is scatterbrained and has trouble with focus. her grading seemed biased, but tests are open book/notes. very smart lady, not meant for the classroom. the lab was rad, but it was tons of work plus 6 hours of lab time per week for 2 units.

OMG! what the hell? I thought this was an undergraduate course? well it was not, it was taught as a graduate course. Extremely hard, and to much detail and information to understand. HARDEST course I've ever taken! ugh!

Again, really hard grading and tests are awful. Few short papers that were graded also pretty roughly and she seemed really scatterbrained a lot of the time. Also, she has kind of an annoying voice and speaking habits that are difficult to listen to

extremely great lectures, easy assigments, and awesome filsm, but her tests are crazy! WAY TOO SPECIFIC for an intro class and her multiple choice is killer. sounds like an easy class but most people end up with C's. take something else!
Her classes are easy to understand as long as you do the required reading, but it's her grading that will screw you over.  You'll enjoy her lectures, but avoid her if you're concerned about your GPA.
